info.title: 22 year old was ragged.
info.desc: In 1975, University of Peradeniya was the first University in Sri Lanka to report a major ragging related incident when a 22 year old student of the Faculty of Agriculture, Rupa Rathnaseeli became paralyzed as a result of having jumped from the second floor of the hostel Ramanathan Hall to escape the physical ragging being carried out by the seniors. She later committed suicide in 1997.

info.title: 22 year old engineering student died.
info.desc: In 1997, 21 year old S. Varapragash, an Engineering student of University of Peradeniya, died from a kidney failure following severe ragging by senior students.

info.title: A female student committed suicide.
info.desc: A girl, also a first year student - in the University of Ruhuna committed suicide in 1997 as she was unable to bear ragging by her senior student.

info.title: A student died from a kidney failure.
info.desc: Kelum Thushara Wijetunge, a first year student at the Hardy Technical institute in Ampara, died in 1997, from a kidney failure after he was forced to do some tough exercises and drink excessive quantities of liquor as a part of ragging.

info.title: A third year Management student was killed.
info.desc: In 2002, Samantha Vithanage, a third year Management student at the University of Sri Jayewardenepura, pioneered an anti-ragging campaign was killed at a meeting while in a discussion about ragging.

info.title: Vice Chancellor resigned due to a ragging incident.
info.desc: Prof. Chandima Wijebandara, the Vice Chancellor of University of Sri Jayewardenepura resigned from his post due to an incident related to ragging. Professor has asked students to completely eliminate ragging from the university. Although the students promised to stop the abuse, they failed to keep the promise, which has resulted in the resignation of the Vice Chancellor.

info.title: Senior students of Jaffna University was banned for sexual harassment.
info.desc: A group of senior students of the Kilinochchi Campus have inhumanely ragged a group of new students by sexually harassing and recording the acts on mobile phones. It has been reported that the new students were forced to provide the recordings to the senior students. As a result, the university administration has decided to impose the ban until the investigations into the incident are completed.

info.title: Seniors suspended for ragging.
info.desc: A group of 54 second-year students of the Sabaragamuwa Universityâ€™s Agriculture Faculty were suspended for one week for ragging first year students at the faculty. The suspected students had detained first year students at the cafeteria without allowing them to follow lectures. They had been subject to severe harassment the previous night also.

info.title: Seven Kelaniya Uni. Students Remanded.
info.desc: They were arrested on a complaint filed by a first year female student who claimed that they ragged her over an imagined rule banning long trousers for first year female students. They had allegedly verbally assaulted her using filthy language
